Collection.name: Records
Collection.type: Eamon.ThirdParty.BTree`1[[Eamon.Framework.IEffect, Eamon, Version=1.3.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null]], Eamon, Version=1.3.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Despite the setting sun, and the coolness that should accompany it, the air begins to grow warm.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Seemingly without cause, the temperature of the air again noticeably increases. Strange, too, is the dawning scent of burning wood. These factors begin to sting your lungs and make breathing strangely uncomfortable.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The everpresent heat becomes excruciatingly intense. Tumults of sweat pour from your brow and sting your eyes, and so great is their discomfort that your lungs disobey your commands to breathe. Your mind screams to take flight, but there is no refuge.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: A barely audible murmur escapes the creature's lips, repeating, as if set on a loop: "Run. Run, Run. Run..."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Though the language spoken by the creature is unknown to you, a candidate interpretation forcefully makes itself salient to you: "Hide. Hide. Hide. Hide..."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Like a monotonic mantra, the creature speaks the following words to itself, oblivious to your presence: "Fire. Fire. Fire. Fire..."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The perceived fire in the air becomes actualized as you open your eyes; the Arcadia you'd dreamt dissolves by the overwhelming force of reality. And that reality is you, awake, in your bed, while the walls burn and roast your surroundings.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You cast yourself through the window and land in the untidy alley outside your quarters. As you steady yourself, you see Hokas Tokas- your present landlord- standing by you, visibly weakened and resting his weight on his staff.*009

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: "Thank Annav you're alive!" shouts Hokas. "We are under siege by the Guild of Bandits; many Free Adventurers have perished in the assault. They seek after an artifact called the 'Runcible Cargo' they'd believed that Sam Slicker had imported.*010

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: "But Sam never received the cargo; you must either locate it and deliver it to the bandits, or else find a means of defeating them!"

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Hokas shouts at you, "Did you not understand me? Time is short! Find the Runcible Cargo or some means of eliminating the attackers!"*012

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: A column of smoke swiftly engulfs the magician, and Hokas disappears within its opacity. When the smoke clears, Hokas has mystically absconded along with it.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The encroaching flames sear your flesh!

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The letter reads:*015

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: "Dear M. Slicker,*016

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: "I regret to communicate to you that amongst the most recent shipment of Ervuolian artifacts, the "Runcible Cargo" will not be found. In light of some unfortunate developments, now is not an optimal time for its display. *017

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: "Respectfully, Professor Larkspur, Eamon University, Mudville"

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The dusty sign reads: "The Eamon Railroad- perhaps the only well-run train left, or one of a very few today. Passengers ride free!"

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The sign reads: "Railroad Office: Authorized Personnel Only!"

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The map reads:*021

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The architect of the Eamon Railroad designed the engines to be voice-activated. Just say the name of one of the following stops:*022

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Frukendorf - Main Hall - Dodge - Mudville*023

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: and you'll be on your way!

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Wiping away the fine, ashen coating, you read the words, "All are invited to the unveiling of the latest trove of Ervuolian artifacts. Uncovered at Archaeological Site #23 near Dodge, this collection features the legendary and eldritch Runcible Cargo."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: seen. To the east, a small path carves through the sand towards a small dock at which is berthed a small, wooden rowboat.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: the Main Hall. You also notice a seared, wooden marquee standing in the corner. With effort, you could undoubtedly determine its intent.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Carved ages ago into the wooden sign are the words: "Welcome to Dodge. If you expect to find friends here, forget about it." A notice of more recent origin has been added as well, reading "Obey the curfew. -Sheriff."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You read the words: "DODGE HOTEL: *030

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Room 08: A.J. (in a rococo script) *031

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Room 11: Brion Gysin (in an ornate script) *032

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Room 14: Professor Larkspur, PhD (in a quite legible script)

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Day 1: My team has arrived at Dodge; the students are setting up a camp at Site 23, though Eamon University and the Eamon Museum have seen fit to arrange for me these accommodations at the hotel. Ah, sweet tenure, and all its associated benefits!*034

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Day 12: The team has uncovered a cache of Ervuolian artifacts of miraculous proportions! Much time will have to be devoted to cataloguing the assortment of idols; so alien appear our finds, it will prove difficult to find an apt vocabulary to do so. *035

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Day 17: My team today stumbled upon something so uncanny, so foreign, that my attempts to describe it have failed. Words such as "profane" and "majestic" spring to mind, but fail to capture its sense. I have thus taken to calling it "runcible." *039

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Day 19: This morning, in the excitement of a new find, a student knocked over the Runcible Cargo. Some indescribable substance... leaked from it. Into the ground. The student is overly distraught about this forgettable accident. Disturbingly so. *037

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Day 19 (addendum): Augustine- the student who had committed the accident this morning- has taken his own life. I've contacted the University, and we will send his remains back home by rail in the morning. Tragic. *038

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Day 20: Augustine's body is... gone. A local drunk claimed that he'd seen Augustine walking aimlessly in the forest this morning, but then proceeded to spin a yarn about seeing his dead sister and mother running through the forest as well. Useless. *040

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Day 18: I've arranged a lucrative deal with Sam Slicker to display our finds in the University branch at the Main Hall. Yet I admit some misgivings about displaying that "Runcible Cargo" to the public. *036

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Day 21: I awoke from a dream near midnight. Peering out the window, into the grounds outside the hotel, I saw Augustine, standing silently, looking up at my room. He wore a face of utter... hunger. *041

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Day 23: Whatever this plague may be that has befallen Dodge, it is out of control. The dead hide behind every shadow. I've collected the most important of the artifacts, and at first light will attempt to spirit them away, back to the safety of Mudville.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: A surprising number of bank robberies are detailed on this board, but those dated more recently deal with more arcane subjects; sightings of the deceased running in the forest and a spate of disappearances are particularly salient.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: A single page of the dusty notebooks, appearing more recently written upon than the rest, singles itself for inspection. It reads: *044

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Day 24: I am unable to escape Dodge. The forest is alive with the abominable dead. Site #23 is like a fortress already, so I've decided to hide within the safety of its fences. I've also decided to leave this page here for narrative effect.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The sign reads: "Eamon University Archaeological Site #23."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: you see a warm, red glow from a window in a southern building.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: As you ascend through the grate, a beautiful woman greets you. She says, "The House of Ill Repute has had to go underground since the K.E.C. started leaning on us, but I'd rather deal with them than the Bandit's Guild. Let me come with you on your quest."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The heavy door to Sam Slicker's shop slams behind you with an equally heavy crash.@@002

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The soft grasses of the Main Hall railyards absorb the impact as you throw yourself out of the high window. Looking southward, you doubt that you can scale that wall.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The sign reads "Ockham's Inn, to the East! All Free Adventurers welcome! Great meals at rock-bottom prices!"

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The man in the oven introduces himself as Bill and says, "Thanks for saving my neck there. Bandits stormed in this evening, and threw me in that oven. Thank Terza they didn't turn it on! Why don't we settle our scores together?"

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: From the large oven you hear the sound of something struggling.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: "Well, well, well," says the tall Amazon, "if it isn't my favorite customer, Bill."*054

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Bill of Ockham, clearly embarrassed, just smiles sheepishly.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The parchment reads: "Objective of Operation: To recover the Ervuolian artifact known as the "Runcible Cargo."*056

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: "Directions: Majority of forces (Bdes 1, 6, and 9) are directed to take control of the Main Hall of the Guild of Free Adventurers. The artifact has been advertised as soon to be displayed at that position. *057

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: "Additional forces (Bdes 25 and 92) are directed to make reconnaissance at Archaeological Site #23 at Dodge and Eamon University at Mudville, respectively. If artifact is not found at primary target, odds are it will be secured at these locations.*058

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: "Rules of Engagement: Deadly force is authorized for use against any resistance. Looting and pillaging are, being this the Bandit's Guild, authorized and encouraged.*059

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: "Authorized this date, Bandit's Guild Strategic Command, Frukendorf."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You have improbably vanquished the entirety of the Bandit Guild's military forces threatening the Main Hall. The Guild, however, is large, and organized, and undoubtedly its prince still covets after the "Runcible Cargo."*143

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The reports read: "Bde 92 has established operations in Mudville. Local population is minimal and cooperative. Will recon the university for signs of the "Runcible Cargo."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The sign reads: "Welcome to the City of Mudville! Population: 1."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The light of the moon permits you to make out the words: "Fortunes told here."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: As you free the old crone from the ropes that bind her, the fortuneteller cries, "As compensation for your kindness, let me tell your fortune."*065

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Pulling out her dazzling crystal ball, she gazes deeply into the sphere and pronounces to you:*066

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: "I see a room, and a table, around which are gathered the following party: a horse, a wren, yourself, and a rabbit. It is the rabbit's birthday! He turns his terribly elongated face to face you, and asks, 'Where is my cake?'"

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: This weathered sign reads: "Water here is polluted! It is bad news! Keep out, or else!"

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: A man whose fine, plate armor peeks from beyond his black coat rises as you enter the camp. "Greetings, Free Adventurer. If you have made it to our camp, you must be stronger than your brethren. The Bandit's Guild, as you know, respects strength.*069

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: "Perhaps," he continues, "we can strike a deal. The "Runcible Cargo" has proven difficult to acquire. Locate this object and bring it to the Bandit Prince in Frukendorf; if this is done, we shall withdraw from your Main Hall and grant you a bounty.*070

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: "Two thousand gold, shall we say? Of course," he says, gesturing to the throngs of soldiers about him, "if you'd rather take the noble route, you're free to attack."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The Bandit Commander rises, and asks, "Have you the "Runcible Cargo"? If not, we have no business. Unless..." he grins, "...you wish to settle this with blood."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The Bandit Guild commander looks at you in disbelief and says, "You have it? You have the "Runcible Cargo"? Now, secure a train from the railyards. We shall permit you to escort it to Frukendorf, whereupon word shall be sent for my party to withdraw."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The sign reads "Underpass to Eamon University."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: One name on the board grabs your attention; "Professor Larkspur, Second Floor, Department of Archaeology, College of Physical Sciences and Necromancy."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: This map of the campus reads: "North is the Department of Quantum Engineering, West is the Department of Alchemy, and East is the Department of Archaeology. Other departments are on the North Campus."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Upon reading this report, you get the feeling as if you've come to understand a bit more about how the Speed spell works.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You read the forbidden manual of terror. It wasn't all bad, actually; quite humorous in some parts, though you concede that the plot did get a bit bogged down in the middle.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: One passage in particular catches your eye: "With technology so complex and obscure as to be described only as "ineffable," the Ervuolian people were said to have harnessed the power between life and death.*079

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: "Some scholars suggest that it was through such technology that the Ervuolian people flourished, while others hint that it was the cause of their decline, and eventual extinction."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Upon this torn scrap of paper are written the digits: "1-2-3-4." Quite original.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The answer key reads: "D-D-D-D-D-D-D-D-D..." So the old strategy of just marking "D" really works under some circumstances!

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The salient portions of the grant proposal read: "Recent information has been uncovered suggesting the remains of an Ervuolian compound beneath the earth west of the city of Dodge... I propose assembling a team of graduate students to survey the site.*083

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: "In addition to the inherent value of any such artifacts, it is suggested that a peculiar artifact, only legendary up until now, might be found at this location...*084

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: "According to legend, human language is too limited in its richness to capture the properties of this object, described as "ineffable" or "indescribable." Indeed, I've become accustomed to just making up words when discussing the object.*085

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: "Nevertheless, I am willing to sacrifice my reputation as capital... In any case, I believe that insight into the mystery of the Evruolian culture's rapid decline might be gained were this object to be discovered."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Bill of Ockham whispers that he has kept a set of keys from his tenure at Eamon University, and quickly unlocks the eastern door to the Department of Archaeology. "This might make the search a bit more swift... and less dangerous," he tells you quietly.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: As you enter the quad from the Department of Archaeology, you unlock the great door that had previously barred your entrance.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You hope for some new insight into the Speed spell, but nothing comes.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The front page of the Eamon Enquirer reads: "Strange Occurrences in Dodge: A recent outbreak of violent crime and disappearances shouldn't be so strange in a city in which bank robberies are daily phenomena.*090

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: "However, coupled with strange rumors circulating about sightings of pale, corpse-like creatures running through the forest, it seems that whatever is happening in Dodge is not merely the routine activity of bank robbers, as the sheriff insists."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The captive fortuneteller jerks her body against her restraints, knocking up a cloud of dust from the floor as she does so.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Here, at the bottom of the gaping hole, lies a weary man in tattered clothing, clutching some amorphous device. Upon your descent, the man feebly lifts himself from the dirt floor and weakly whispers, "I... am Professor... Larkspur.*093

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: "I tried to escape... was forced to retreat to the site. You... must be warned. You need... my insight. But there's little time. My medicine... fetch my medicine. I can tell you... more... then."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Prof. Larkspur swallows the pills and, after a moment, his demeanor visibly improves. "Thank you," he says. "I presume you've come for the "Runcible Cargo." If this is the case, you must heed my warnings about this most unusual artifact.*095

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: "Aeons ago, the continent was ruled by a now-gone race known as the Ervuolians. Though the throne was at the island Ervuol, their power was great and through some mysterious means, their influence grew over the entire continent.*096

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: "The nature of their power's source has been lost to the shroud of time. I believe that this object that we've uncovered supplies the answer. And it is not altogether wholesome.*097

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: "It was some necromantic analogue of slavery, I believe now, that secured their prominence and sealed their fate. This object, as the events of the last few days suggest, is capable of raising not only the dead, but perhaps something worse.*098

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: "I can't stop you from taking this artifact. But know that its mere accidental triggering condemned my team and Dodge itself. If you open it, only do so briefly; were it to be opened entirely, or shattered, the consequences would be terrible.*148

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The engine lurches on the tracks, and steadily plunges into the dark, southeastern countryside of Eamon. After a quarter of an hour, the train halts with a jerk and its door opens with a cloud of steam obscuring the night-drenched town of Dodge.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: In fits and starts, the engine begins its northwestern journey, winding its way across the eastern provinces. Slowly, the engine approaches the moonlit Main Hall railyards, and grinds to a halt east of a commercial rail platform.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: In a cloud of steam, the engine churns forth towards the east. After fifteen minutes have elapsed, the engine slows as it arrives at the Mudville station. Under the shadow of the northern Eamon University, the door opens south onto the aging platform.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: With apparent effort, the aging engine slowly picks up steam in a westwardly direction. The engine idly carves through the dark countryside, finally halting alongside the eerie calm of Dodge. The door opens and the silence of the town infects the cabin.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The train stalls for a moment, then suddenly jerks southward. The tracks eventually guide the engine east. In the engine's spotlight, the town of Dodge approaches and then falls away into darkness. After half an hour, you arrive at the town of Mudville.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The ancient steam engine crawls from the station towards the dark west countryside. To the left, the light of the engine catches the small town of Dodge as you pass it in the night. After half an hour, the train ultimately stops at the familiar Main Hall.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The gilded sign reads: "Welcome to Frukendorf, Sponsor of and Home to the Main Hall of the Bandit's Guild."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The Prince of Bandits won't permit you to leave until the "Runcible Cargo" is delivered to him.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The western journey of the engine is interrupted as you reach an enormous barricade erected over the tracks by the Bandit's Guild.*108

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: "We cannot allow you to pass unless you bear the "Runcible Cargo," announces a guard standing outside the engine. Dismayed, you return to your point of departure.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The engine lurches forward under your command. As you pass the Main Hall, your progress is interrupted by a Bandit's Guild checkpoint. A guard peers in, notes the presence of the "Runcible Cargo," and nods to raise the barrier.*110

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The sun rises in the east as the engine begins its journey to Frukendorf anew. As the Eamon Railroad is automated and the journey long, you close your eyes.*111

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You dream of sitting at a tea party, attended by myriad surreal creatures. In the dream, a tall rabbit sits next to you. He turns his uncanny visage towards you, and whispers in your ear, "If you spoil the cake, you spoil the party as well."*112

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The engine's arrival into the Frukendorf station awakens you from your sleep at that moment. After a brief spell, the door swings open to the north, allowing you to proceed to the Main Hall of the Bandit's Guild.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You push off into the still waters of the Great Sea.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You carefully disembark from the boat.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The sign reads: "The Eamon Railroad is voice-automated. Once inside the cabin, just say the name of your destination, e.g., Frukendorf, Main Hall, Dodge, or Mudville, and you'll be on your way to fun and adventure."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Your old friend, Larcenous Lil, grins and exclaims, "Those creatures have been trying to get into this cell since yesterday! It was a matter of time before one figured out how to break in; I'd have been a snack for sure! I owe you one for the rescue."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The tall Amazon you met at the House of Ill Repute leans to you and gestures towards Lil. "I'd keep my eye on that one, if I were you," she says. "In my line of work, you know a bad apple when you see one."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Bill of Ockham looks over at Lil and turns towards you, whispering, "We're all equal in the eyes of Terza, but some are less equal than others. With a name like Larcenous Lil, it isn't apparent that that girl is worthy of our trust."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Her face suddenly alight with greed, Larcenous Lil violently snatches the Runcible Cargo. "Sorry, my dear," she coos, "The gold this artifact will fetch outweighs the ethereal value of our friendship. In any case, you'll still forgive me eventually."@003

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Larcenous Lil prepares to attack!

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Peering into the ornate telescope, the remote province of Frukendorf to the west, the fires of an encampment of bandits to the north, and the towns of Dodge and Mudville reveal themselves, all nestled in the rolling and darkened landscape of Eamon.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: A young woman smiles at you from behind the bars of a jail cell, shouting, "Break down the door! Quickly!"

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: As you disembark the train, Bill of Ockham leans towards you, whispering: "To just give them the artifact is cowardice, but to destroy it here- to unleash its infernal power- would decimate your enemy. Perhaps we employ those explosives."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: As you disembark the train, your Amazonian companion whispers to you: "Surely you don't intend on allowing the Bandit's Guild free use of that artifact. Perhaps those explosives could permit us to turn the artifact's power against the Guild."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: As you enter the throne room of the Bandit's Guild, the Bandit Prince rises. "Greetings," he says. "Today you have proven yourself the veritable salvation of the Free Adventurers.*126

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: "Give me the Runcible Cargo," he continues, "and I give you my word that I will immediately withdraw my forces from your Main Hall, as well as provide you with adequate recompense for your efforts in securing this artifact."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: "Well," says the Bandit Prince, "have you decided to surrender the artifact to me? I remind you that as you deliberate, your Main Hall is burning. Give me the artifact and put an end to the siege."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You reach to something approximating a lever, but as your fingers come into contact with the uncanny device, a visceral sense of loathing fills you. You instinctively retract your touch, guessing that no good can come of activating the artifact.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You slowly crack open the odd device, and are met by an instantaneous feeling of repugnance. If it must be opened, you sense that it must not be kept open for long.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: As an overpowering sense of dread descends upon you and thickens, you unflinchingly jerk the otherworldly "Runcible Cargo" shut.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The Bandit Commander hands the artifact back to you, saying "The Prince of Bandits would prefer that you deliver this directly to him in Frukendorf. Take the Eamon Railroad and my guards will permit you to pass our blockade."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The Prince of Bandits takes the Runcible Cargo from you, the ghost of a smile revealing itself on his lips. "I have lost many men in pursuit of this artifact," he says. "The Bandit's Guild, had you not delivered this device, would be thus crippled.*133

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: "But you have provided our salvation," he continues. "By means of this device, should the rumors prove correct, the Bandit's Guild will be able to strengthen its numbers artificially, through the means of its arcane power.*134

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: "The Ervuolian dynasty was filled with aesthetes and philosophers. It is no small wonder such weak kings failed to harness this infernal artifact and ultimately fell. Under the authority of a noble bandit the Guild may extend its malignant reign.*135

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: "You have delivered the world into our hands. I will honor my word and withdraw from the Main Hall of the Guild of Free Adventurers and pay your reward. You may take the train back to your home. Your lands will, for now, be free of our influence."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Perhaps it would be wise to wait for a sufficient reason to do that.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Detonating the explosive device, with the gates of Frukendorf still wide open, might not be a wise idea.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Moments after you trigger the detonator, the morning calm is broken violently by an immense blast coming from the Bandit's Main Hall. As the impact subsides, it is replaced by a sound utterly otherworldly.*139

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: From behind the barred doors of Frukendorf emerges a crescendo of inhuman cries, as if the gates of hell were methodically opening. Whatever has been unleashed within Frukendorf's walls, you are grateful those walls stand between you and its fury.*143

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The massive gates of Frukendorf slam behind you; the sound of mechanical ratcheting and whirring hums as they are sealed.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: As you begin to utter the name of your destination, you hesitate. After such an exhausting night, perhaps you ought to return to the Main Hall of the Guild of Free Adventurers.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: After a bitter battle, you fell the Prince of Bandits and his guard. Though the head has been removed from the beast, as it were, the remnants of the Bandit's Guild are yet unvanquished, and the death of their prince may embolden their ranks.*143

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You return to the smoldering Main Hall of the Guild of Free Adventurers worn from the night's adventures, but nevertheless triumphant. The beneficiaries of your valiant acts drop their work clearing the rubble to stand in awe as you walk past them.*144

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: It will take time for the Bandit's Guild to attain even a whisper of their previous strength. Time enough for the Free Adventurers to refortify. And time enough for you to enjoy a well-deserved Double Dragon Blomb.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The train miserably lurches eastward into the morning sun towards the Main Hall. You have secured a temporary reprieve for your fellow Free Adventurers, but have given to the Bandit's Guild the infernal key of conquest for which their blood was spilt.*146

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: It was undoubtedly a devil's bargain, and as you, weary from the night's events, enter the Main Hall of the Guild of Free Adventurers few of those struggling to rebuild its walls from the siege's devastation rise to meet your gaze.*147

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Yet more important tasks lay ahead; the tasks of rebuilding the Main Hall, of refortifying its walls, of reclaiming its esteem and influence await. Whatever plans the Bandit's Guild may be making, there remains time to rise to the occasion.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: "Should you," he finishes, "be bent on its destruction, I suggest to you that the Department of Quantum Engineering has been working on some extraordinarily thorough explosive devices. I would not advise being present for such a demonstration, however."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: As what should be a fatal blow befalls Hokas Tokas, he dramatically disappears in a column of thick smoke.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Larcenous Lil, injured, flees and is irreversibly absorbed into the night@@001

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Professor Larkspur, weakened by the blow, finds the strength to flee into the safety of the night.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: As you reenter the Eamon University quad, you unlock the door to the Department of Alchemy.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The tall Amazon hands your gold back to you and says "That's a real sweet gesture but this isn't nearly enough to afford my company. Perhaps once this is over, we can talk to McFenney and look into getting you a loan."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The Amazon hands you back your gold. "You are persistent, aren't you?" she says. "Look, I do charity work for the poor on occasion as a tax write-off. If you'd like to take advantage of my 'charitable contributions,' talk to my accountant next week."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The Amazon returns your gold to you, smiling. "Sugar, I only charge a fee for the men," she says. "Why don't you and I get a Double Dragon Blomb after the Main Hall is no longer under siege and see what comes of it?"

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The Amazon forcefully hands back your gold, saying "If, in the midst of this chaos, your attention is drawn to the carnal, I have seriously misjudged your character. Consider my offer of a drink revoked, with prejudice."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The text of the pamphlet reads:*158

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Dear Valued Client,*159

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: As you know, the Keep Eamon Clean Committee has done its best to keep you away from the 'corrupting influence' of our services. We're pleased to announce that we are back in business at a new, literally underground location.*160

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The House of Ill Repute can be located through the northeast corner of the Main Hall sewer system. Of course, your discretion is appreciated; the Great Brothel War was a painful chapter in Eamon history, one we shouldn't want repeated.*161

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: -Eowyn Fleiss, Proprietor, House of Ill Repute

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Its sturdy design and construction resist your attack.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: gates of Frukendorf

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: LARGE OVEN.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: A riveting experience, not to be missed! Original Eamon Deluxe adventure EDX-22 by Thomas Ferguson. Eamon CS port by Michael R. Penner.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Admittedly, you don't know how you got here, but a relaxing, if uncanny, sunset greets your gaze.*168

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: But you have unexpected company, in the form of an incredibly large rabbit.*169

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Being a seasoned Eamonaut, a rabbit of this stature should seem pedestrian. You, after all, have battled wizards with rocket launchers and engaged in space opera with broadswords...*170

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: ...so why does this rabbit unnerve you so?

Collection.name: FreeUids
